intro: Lopezia elegans, commonly known as the elegant Lopezia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, clustered inflorescences. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are usually small and pink or red, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Lopezia elegans is often found in scrublands and along canyon walls, where it contributes to the biodiversity of its habitat.
